_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Services to Buildings and Dwellings

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

A Diamond Pool, Inc. provides chlorination for recreational swimming pools in the Phoenix, Arizona area.  A Diamond Pool, Inc has ensured a safe operation dating back to 1993.

A Diamond Pool's owner is personally committed to offer superior service and to maintain a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities.  The owner administers the company's safety and environmental policies. He is also responsible for various inspections to ensure compliance, and oversees the entire safety and environmental programs.  These programs include, hazard communications, employee safety manuals, manufacturers documentation, Emergency Response, as well as the Risk Management Plan.

FACILITY AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED

Startup of the chlorine system occurred in November 1993.  The process is located at 21411 North 11th Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85027.  The chlorine transfer process for A Diamond Pool, Inc. consists of chlorine one-ton containers which are the storage vessels.  Chlorine liquid is dispensed from the one ton container through a filling manifold to a 20 pound cylinder.  The system is operated manually; therefore, someone is present when ever the container valve is open.  During off-hours, the container valve is closed and the system is shut down.

The maximum quantity of chlorine on site is 8000 pounds.


ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

A Diamond Pool, Inc. has a Process Safety Management program to manage the handling of chlorine.  In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.  This includes common practices outlined by the Chlorine Institute and the National Association of Gas Chlorinators.  

The owner and operator of the facility has over 30 years of experience in the gas chlorination industry with a perfect histo

ry of no chlorine releases.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Based on the Hazard Assessment Addendum (June 2004), the five year accident history investigation (June 1999 - June 2004) revealed that there has been no reportable release of chlorine at the facility.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The A Diamond Pool, Inc. has an emergency action plan in effect at the facility.  The Emergency Action Plan (Plan) is detailed in the Emergency Planning and Response section of the PSM/RMP document.  The basis of the Plan is for the facility to contact the Fire Department (9-1-1) in the event of an emergency.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

A Diamond Pool has conducted a PSM/RMP Compliance Audit (May 2004) and revalidated the Process Hazard Analysis (April 2004).  All recommendations resulting from the PHA will be completed by December 2004.  The Process Hazard Analysis Revalidation resulted in the following recommendation:

REV01: Update operating procedures in PSM/RMP Program document.

The Process Safety Management team will continue to provide a safe environment by ensuring employee involvement in safety development and training.
